intro: Dombeya kandoensis, commonly known as the Kando dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a rough texture. Dombeya kandoensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests.
